CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {7} slices in this chart.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Frozen Foods show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Frozen Foods shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Organic Produce reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Plant-based Alternatives} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =18.1?
EVJ.A: At X =18.1,the label with the highest density is {Processed Foods}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 40? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Organic Produce}'s peak at {51},{Conventional Farming}'s peak at {60},{Gourmet Ingredients}'s peak at {63},{Imported Goods}'s peak at {82}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 49? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Plant-based Alternatives}'s peak at {9},{Processed Foods}'s peak at {12},{Frozen Foods}'s peak at {10}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Processed Foods or Imported Goods?
NC.A: {Imported Goods} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Processed Foods or Gourmet Ingredients?
NC.A: {Gourmet Ingredients} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.
